_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Effingham Equity is committed to the prevention of any accidental releases fo anhydrous ammonia.  Our prevention program includes the use of proper equipment, regular inspections and maintenance and training of all employees that work with the material.  Should an accidental release occur, the facility has oriented the Farina Volunteer Fire Dept. and the Fayette County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC).  These steps have been taken to assure a quick response to any release and minimize the impact of the release in our community and environment.

The primary activity at the facility is the storage of anhydrous ammonia for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.  

This facility has developed a worst case and alternate case scenario, however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security sensitive information as requested by the EPA.

Effingham Equity complies with all rules and regulations relating to the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia including the Illinois Department of Agriculture regulations as well as OSHA 29 CFR - 1910-111 regarding proper storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia for the covered process in the past five years.

Effingham Equity has  a written emergency action plan in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR- 1910.38.  Emergency planning and community right to know information is provided to the Illinois Emergency Management Agency, LEPC and local fire department as required by SARA Title III of EPCRA.

Improving safety at Effingham Equity is an on-going process.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe practices and operations.  There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
